person-name.narrative: Andrew Velthaus, Jennifer Lee, and Kelley Vito

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Budget and Financial Accountability - Burma

description.narrative: The OTA Budget and Financial Accountability Team will provide an intermittent advisor to the Ministry of Finance to support the implementation of a component of the governments public financial management (PFM) reform strategy. The advisor will develop training and facilitate workshops for the Ministry of Finance Budget Department in establishing a State-owned Economic Enterprise (SEE) monitoring function. OTA is finalizing a work plans for two intermittent projects with the Ministry of Finance, one of which is this proposed project.

person-name.narrative: Andrew Velthaus, Jennifer Lee, and Kelley Vito

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Burma - Economic Crimes

description.narrative: Provide technical assistance to the Myanmar Financial Intelligence Unit (MFIU) and other government of Burma (GoB) stakeholders focused on anti-money laundering and counter-terrorist financing (AML/CFT) regime development and organizational development issue. Assistance includes: (a) support for the MFIU towards the aim of becoming a functioning financial intelligence unit that meets international standards to include establishment of an electronic reporting, analytic and case management system; (b) support for improving risk-based supervision of the financial sector; and (iii) collaboration with UNODC on support for money laundering case development and asset forfeiture procedures.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date
Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Andrew Velthaus, Jennifer Lee, and Kelley Vito

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Economic Crimes

description.narrative: Provide technical assistance to the Myanmar Financial Intelligence Unit (MFIU) and other government of Burma (GoB) stakeholders focused on anti-money laundering and counter-terrorist financing (AML/CFT) regime development and organizational development issues, including: (a) assisting the MFIU to become a functioning financial intelligence unit that meets international standards, and (b) helping to enhance cooperation between the MFIU and AML/CFT counterparts including the Central Bank of Myanmar (CBM).

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date
Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Andrew Velthaus, Jennifer Lee, and Kelley Vito

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Economic Crimes - Burma

description.narrative: Enhance the operational effectiveness of the Myanmar Financial Intelligence Unit (MFIU) to include (a) issuance of guidance to improve the timeliness and quality of suspicious activity reporting; (b) strategic analysis of suspicious transaction reports; (c) development of standard operating procedures (SOPs) for data reception, processing, dissemination, feedback and information exchange; and (d) development of a MFIU operations manual; (e) statistical reporting as required by the Financial Action Task Force (FATF) Recommendations; and (f) support development of the electronic reporting system (ERS) and development of an analytic system. The project continues to focus on promoting the Central Bank of Myanmar (CBM), Ministry of Planning and Finance (MPF), Securities and Exchange Commission of Myanmar (SECM), and the MFIU supervisory capacity of financial institutions and designated non-financial businesses and professions (DNFBPs) respectively, consistent with risk-based principles of the work plan. The project also focuses on money laundering case development and asset forfeiture procedures support for law enforcement agencies.

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Economic Crimes - Burma

description.narrative: Enhance the operational effectiveness of the Myanmar Financial Intelligence Unit (MFIU) to include (a) issuance of guidance to improve the timeliness and quality of suspicious activity reporting; (b) strategic analysis of suspicious transaction reports; (c) development of standard operating procedures (SOPs) for data reception, processing, dissemination, feedback and information exchange; and (d) development of a MFIU operations manual; (e) statistical reporting as required by the Financial Action Task Force (FATF) Recommendations; and (f) support development of the electronic reporting system (ERS) and development of an analytic system. The project continues to focus on promoting the Central Bank of Myanmar (CBM), Ministry of Planning and Finance (MPF), Securities and Exchange Commission of Myanmar (SECM), and the MFIU supervisory capacity of financial institutions and designated non-financial businesses and professions (DNFBPs) respectively, consistent with risk-based principles of the work plan. activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date
Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Andrew Velthaus, Jennifer Lee, and Kelley Vito

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Economic Crimes -Burma

description.narrative: Enhance the operational effectiveness of the MFIU to include 1) issuance of guidance to improve the timeliness and quality of suspicious activity reporting; 2) strategic analysis of suspicious transaction reports; 3) development of standard operating procedures (SOPs) for data reception, processing, dissemination, feedback and information exchange; and 4) development of a MFIU operations manual; 5) statistical reporting as required by the FATF Recommendations; and 6) support development of the electronic reporting system (ERS) and development of an analytic system. The project also has focused on 1) promoting the CBM and FRD supervisory capacity of financial institutions and designated non-financial businesses and professions (DNFBPs) respectively, consistent with risk-based principles; and 2) developing AML/CFT investigative, prosecutorial and asset recovery capacity across the range of all Burmese AML/CFT enforcement stakeholders.

person-name.narrative: Andrew Velthaus, Jennifer Lee, and Kelley Vito

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Revenue Policy and Administration

description.narrative: Resident advisor scheduled to assist in establishing a Large Taxpayer function, which will have the greatest impact on revenue and taxpayer participation at the corporate level; assist in self-assessment as taxpayers do not voluntarily file and pay; coach in project management, due to the overwhelming amount of foundation building and change required of this immature tax administration.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date
Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Andrew Velthaus, Jennifer Lee, and Kelley Vito

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Burma - Revenue Policy and Administration

description.narrative: Resident advisor helping establish and develop a Large Taxpayer function, which will have the greatest impact on revenue and taxpayer participation at the corporate level; assisting in self-assessment as taxpayers do not voluntarily file and pay; coaching in project management, due to the overwhelming amount of foundation building and change required of this immature tax administration. Site visits scheduled for 2015 will continue audit and collections training as well as development of collections and audit manuals; conduct basic instructor training to build institutional capacity to develop and implement future training programs; and provide executive and mid-level management training to improve personnel management practices within the organization.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date
Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Andrew Velthaus, Jennifer Lee, and Kelley Vito

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Burma - Revenue Policy and Adminstration

description.narrative: Resident advisor helping establish and develop a Large Taxpayer function, which will have the greatest impact on revenue and taxpayer participation at the corporate level; assisting in self-assessment as taxpayers who do not voluntarily file and pay; coaching in project management, due to the overwhelming amount of foundation building and change required of this immature tax administration; and providing classroom and on-the-job training and development to support audits and collections. Site visits scheduled for 2016 will continue implementing procedures and training put in place in 2014 and 2015, for audit (including specialized industries), collections, and public relations. The resident and intermittent advisors will focus efforts on ensuring accuracy of returns and payment of obligations, improving operational efficiency and effectiveness, and supporting voluntary compliance.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date
Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Andrew Velthaus, Jennifer Lee, and Kelley Vito

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Revenue Administration and Revenue Policy - Burma

description.narrative: Resident advisor helped establish a Large Taxpayer Office (LTO) function and is advising on implementation of a self-assessment regime, which will have the greatest impact on revenue and taxpayer participation at the corporate level. The project provides assistance in self-assessment to taxpayers, explaining the new filing requirements and common errors; coaches the LTO in project management, due to the overwhelming amount of foundation building and change required of this immature tax administration; and provides classroom and on-the-job training and development to support basic and specialized industry audits and collections. The resident and intermittent advisors focus efforts on ensuring accuracy of returns and payment of obligations, improving operational efficiency and effectiveness, and supporting voluntary compliance. Site visits from 2014 - 2016 put in place and further developed procedures and training for audit, collections, and public relations. Starting in late 2016, the project began providing classroom-based and on-the-job audit training to the Medium Taxpayer Office 1 (MTO #1) to support implementation of a self-assessment regime for medium-sized busine

person-name.narrative: Andrew Velthaus, Jennifer Lee, and Kelley Vito

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Revenue Administration and Revenue Policy - Burma

description.narrative: Resident advisor helped establish a Large Taxpayer Office (LTO) function and is advising on implementation of a self-assessment regime, which will have the greatest impact on revenue and taxpayer participation at the corporate level. The project provides assistance in self-assessment to taxpayers, explaining the new filing requirements and common errors; coaches the LTO in project management, due to the overwhelming amount of foundation building and change required of this immature tax administration; and provides classroom and on-the-job training and development to support basic and specialized industry audits and collections. The resident and intermittent advisors focus efforts on ensuring accuracy of returns and payment of obligations, improving operational efficiency and effectiveness, and supporting voluntary compliance. Site visits from 2014 - 2016 put in place and further developed procedures and training for audit, collections, and public relations. Starting in late 2016, the project began providing classroom-based and on-the-job audit training to the Medium Taxpayer Office 1 (MTO #1) to support implementation of a self-assessment regime for medium-sized busine
